day1.content:
‘~해서 좋았다’는 to 부정사 (to+동사원형)를 이용하여 to 부정사의 부사적 용법 중  원인의 의미로 써서 활용할 수 있다. 즉, ‘I was happy’는 “나는 행복했다’이고 to+동사원형은 ‘~해서’의 의미로, 다음과 같이 실제로 여러 상황에서 요긴하게 쓸 수 있다.

1. 난생 처음 운전해서 기분 좋았다.
I was happy to drive for the first time in my life.
2. 다른 사람들을 도와줘서 기분 좋았다.
I was happy to help others.
3. 나는 만점을 받아서 기분 좋았다.
I was happy to get a perfect score.

words.sentence_en: I was happy to drink some coffee
I was happy to play the computer games
I was happy to eat Chinese food
I was happy to watch TV
I was happy to buy my own cell phone
I was happy to fix my computer

day2.content:
Plan은 ‘계획, 계획하다’라는 뜻이다. I am planning to+동사원형은 ‘~할 계획이다’ 라는 것을 의미하며 I am planning to learn English는 ‘영어를 배울 계획이다’라는 뜻이 된다.

1. 학교로 돌아갈 계획이야.
I’m planning to go back to school.
2. 컴퓨터를 고치고 더 빠르게 만들 계획이다.
I’m planning to fix my computer and make it faster.
3. 서울로 이사하고 직업을 구할 계획이다.
I’m planning to move to Seoul and find a job.

words.sentence_en: I am planning to break up with my boyfriend
words.sentence_ko: 나는 내 남자 친구와 헤어질 계획이다

words.sentence_en: I am planning to find something expensive
I am planning to pass the exam
I am planning to play the guitar
I am planning to go to school
I am planning to start my own project
words.sentence_ko: 나는 내 자신의 프로젝트를 시작할 계획이다

day3.content:
Be about to+동사원형은 ‘막 ~하려고 하다’는 뜻이다. I was about to sleep은 ‘막 자려던 참이다’라는 뜻이 된다.

1. 나도 같은 질문을 그에게 하려던 참이었다.
I was about to ask him the same question.
2. 특별한 것을 막 목격하려던 참이었다.
I was about to witness something special.
3. 비행기에 막 탑승하려던 참이었다.
I was about to board an airplane.
4. 바보처럼 행동했던 것에 대해 그녀에게 미안하다고 막 말하려던 참이었다.
I was about to tell her that I was sorry for acting like a fool.

words.sentence_en: I was about to do my homework
I was about to see horror movies
I was about to meet my friend
I was about to read the book
I was about to play the guitar
I was about to help my friend
